body_html: @apaszke Are you recommending that we have a new backend, SparseMaskedTensor? Even if we do it that way, you still shouldn't call the operation sum, because it's not a sum. I suppose that if SparseMaskedTensor is just a Python-level only wrapper on top of tensor and not actually a tensor, you're allowed to do that, but if you want it to be an honest to goodness Tensor you have to respect our semantics which say, at the very least, that the derivative of all operations called "sum" should be the same.

body: @apaszke Are you recommending that we have a new backend, `SparseMaskedTensor`? Even if we do it that way, you still shouldn't call the operation `sum`, because it's not a sum. I suppose that if `SparseMaskedTensor` is just a Python-level only wrapper on top of tensor and not actually a tensor, you're allowed to do that, but if you want it to be an honest to goodness Tensor you have to respect our semantics which say, at the very least, that the derivative of all operations called "sum" should be the same.
